meanings.definition: The quality or state of being suitable for traffic or transportation.
meanings.sent1: The trafficabilities of the new road made it easy for cars to move smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The city's trafficabilities improved after the construction of wider roads.
meanings.sent3: The trafficabilities of the old bridge were so poor that even the ducks avoided crossing it.
meanings.sent4: Her organizational skills had the trafficabilities of a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The trafficabilities of the subway system were so efficient that commuters never experienced delays.

meanings.definition: The ability to be easily navigated or traveled through.
meanings.sent1: The forest path's trafficabilities allowed hikers to explore without getting lost.
meanings.sent2: The trafficabilities of the airport made it convenient for travelers to find their gates.
meanings.sent3: The trafficabilities of the maze were so confusing that even the mice got lost.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had the trafficabilities of a well-organized library, making it easy to find information.
meanings.sent5: The trafficabilities of the river's current guided the raft safely downstream.
